reviewText:
A Resource-Management Strategy / Puzzle Gamehttps://youtu.be/g9IWszElhzU
This game is somewhat odd, I'll explain how the game works.
You have 4 resources: Life, Wealth, Power, and Faith
You start out with a few or so of each resource.
The Goal" is to get a lot of one or maybe 2 resources. (So let's say we need 10 Wealth to win)
You can trade any reosurce for 2 of another resource
date: but you can only do this a limited amount of times.\nSo say you trade 1 life for 2 wealth
hoursPlayed:
and 2 faith for 4 wealth = 10 wealth you win
(watch the video above to get a better idea)

+ There is a small bit of strategy
voteText: as you need to keep track of how many "transfer cards" you have
helpfulPercent: once they run out it can be hard to complete the objective if you transferred too much to the wrong resource pool.\n\n- Does a poor job at explaining what you are doing
votesHelpful: and it's pretty odd to say the least. You are supposevely "building" statues and such
votesTotal: but all you are really doing is transferring resource pools to and from each other.\n- The portraits in the character selection screen look pretty silly
votesFunny:
like photoshopped faces
- The gameplay is far too simple
- The upgrade screen is a bit out of place for a game like this...
- Overall I just thought the game was a bit confusing
commentsCount: like a concept that just didn't work out in the end.\n"
column19: 29 of 35 people (83%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Boring! The concept is interesting, but doesn't have a lot of depth. Your only stategy is to beat the 'time' counter.
I loved the developer's two 'Hero of the Kingdom' games, so I bought this one for sale at a buck. Then I made most of that dollar back through luck with dropped cards. I'm still not sure the few cents invested were worth it.

- You're going to hover over the cards a lot (mostly for the bonus/extra cards). Well, the UI makes tooltips show up with a slow fade-in effect that makes you waste a lot of time. Easily a second per card. Grand!

- More time wasters: the wall transition (so slow and ugly!), and the upgrade screen that still shows up even after you've upgraded everything. (Okay, most people will never upgrade everything, so it's not really an issue but...)

- User interface in general is *bad*. Nothing is done to help the player. All you'll be doing in this game is read through numbers, and it doesn't want to make it easy or fun.

- Story is non-existent, and totally unrelated to the actual gameplay screens. It's cliché and probably even insulting to Egyptians. And the story screens, while few in numbers, certainly don't lack in typos. There's only one character, and it's you. But you have nothing to say. You're just a fantastic, extraordinary god-like/snorefest of a person who's also so incredibly kind that they'll help others in exchange for a huge pyramid. Yeah, sure, that's totally someone I can recognize myself in.

So... Yeah, just play the other games by this developer, they're quite good, just not this one. If you want a good card/strategy game, I'm sure you can find it yourself, I'm not your mummy. (Ah. Ah. Egypt. Sorry.)

reviewText:
Empire of the Gods is everything but not strategy as stated in tags :D

Joke on side, it is very decent casual puzzler with nice relaxing egyptian ancient music.

Pro's
+Challenging
+30min daily casual
+Trading
+Achievements

Con's
-Lack of tutorial


Overall;
A good way to spend spare 2 bucks

reviewText: Empire of the Gods is a very addictive strategy-combinatorics-logic-puzzle game, a great way to exercise gray brain cells. Rules are simple and everything is up to you to work out brain. Animations are a little slow, it would be good if there is an option for speed control. Game has everything, achievements, trading cards and lots of fun. Is not expensive and give ti a try.
